instructions.title: How to use Binary to Text Converter

steps.title: Select conversion type
steps.description: Choose the conversion direction: Binary to Text, Text to Binary, Hex to Text, Text to Hex, Binary to Hex, or Hex to Binary.

steps.title: Enter your input
steps.description: Paste or type your binary (e.g., 01001000 01100101), hexadecimal (e.g., 48 65 6C), or plain text depending on your selected conversion.

steps.title: View instant results
steps.description: The conversion happens automatically as you type. Results appear immediately with byte count statistics.

steps.title: Copy or swap the result
steps.description: Use the copy button to save the output, or swap input/output to perform reverse conversion instantly.

features: Swap button for quick reverse conversion
useCases: Decode binary data from network packets
Convert ASCII art to binary representation
Convert machine code to readable format
proTips: Binary input can be space-separated (01001000 01100101) or continuous (0100100001100101)
Hex input supports 0x prefix (0x48656C6C6F) or space-separated (48 65 6C 6C 6F)
Use the swap button to quickly verify round-trip conversion
The tool auto-detects if your input looks like binary, hex, or text
Each ASCII character uses exactly 8 bits (1 byte)
UTF-8 characters may use 1-4 bytes depending on the character
troubleshooting: If binary conversion fails, ensure only 0s and 1s are present
Hex values must use valid characters (0-9 and A-F)
Invalid characters will show an error message
Very long inputs may take a moment to process
Non-ASCII characters are converted using UTF-8 encoding
Ensure binary input length is divisible by 8 for proper character conversion
